meanings.definition: A line of light radiating from a central point

meanings.sent2: The fireworks created a beautiful display of rays in the night sky.

meanings.sent2: The aquarium had a tank dedicated to showcasing different species of rays.

meanings.definition: To emit light in a narrow beam
meanings.sent1: The lighthouse rayed out across the stormy sea, guiding ships to safety.
meanings.sent2: The flashlight rayed into the dark cave, revealing hidden treasures.
meanings.sent3: The disco ball rayed light in all directions, creating a dazzling effect.
meanings.sent4: Her smile rayed warmth and happiness to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The campfire rayed flickering light, casting shadows on the trees around.

meanings.definition: To extend outward in a straight line
meanings.sent1: The road rayed out in front of them, leading to unknown destinations.
meanings.sent2: The tree branches rayed out in all directions, providing shade in the park.
meanings.sent3: The cracks in the wall rayed out like spiderwebs, indicating structural damage.
meanings.sent4: Her influence rayed out to touch the lives of many people in the community.
meanings.sent5: The river rayed out from the mountain, carving its path through the valley.
